data.title: Granddaughter Visit
data.text:
What a great place to take your children or grandchildren, or even just go by yourself.
Some amazing pieces.

data.title: Wonderful Little Collection!
data.text: If you like dolls and doll houses, this is the perfect museum for you.  It is the cutest little shop, and the houses and dolls are precious!  I stumbled upon it while I was walking and window shopping, and it was such a delight!

owner_response.author: Ecmancini, Executive Director at Museum of Miniature Houses and Other Collections, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for  your review.  It is important to us to keep offering new exhibits.  Upcoming in October is Fashion Dolls from the Private Collection of Elizabeth Kraft Taylor, fifty dolls dressed in fabulous designer fashions by Jason Wu and others.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Unique little museum
data.text: Lots of collections of houses and miniatures to see.  Displayed well throughout the building.  Interesting for kids and adults.

data.title: Museum of Miniature Houses
data.text: We took our two oldest grandchildren (8 and 9) here recently, just to explore something interesting and different.  The museum has a little quiz to take along as you walk through, (just for fun) and it tests your ability to find this or that among the various dollhouses.  The kids enjoyed the challenge of searching for items.  Several of the houses on display were home styles from the 50’s and 60’s, when my wife and I were growing up, so it was interesting for us to be reminded of those old appliances and various furniture pieces.  The workmanship of many items throughout these miniature houses is amazing, and well-worth seeing to appreciate.  As I recall the admission was about $5 (but less for children under 10 maybe?), which was very reasonable. I’m sure we will want to bring our other children/grandchildren here in the future whenever they visit us from out-of-town.

data.title: Fun experience
data.text: This was a fun museum to visit. Even if your not a miniature expert. The displays are well maintained , the staff is very welcoming and knowledgeable .

data.title: Beautiful Miniatures....
data.text: Very nice museum.  Perfect for grandmother/mother - daughter outing.  Variety of styles and periods of time.  Even step stools for the little visitors!

data.title: Great little museum full of visual delights for those on a budget
data.text: This little museum has some great pieces for miniature enthusiasts.  It is a true delight and very inexpensive.

data.title: Wonderful Little Museum
data.text: it was a remarkable experience and totally not what we were expecting. if you get a chance you should definitely drop in.

data.title: Candlelight Delight!!!
data.text: What a delight it was from 6-8 on Saturday Dec 5th with grandparents, parents and a small child!!! First time ever and will be happy to come back. So much to see, explore and enjoy. They even have an area for kids to play with a small house.

data.title: Amazing Miniatures
data.text: Our  convention scheduled a bus tour there.  It was opened specially for our group.  They had a full staff of docents on hand and special sales items for us.  The displays are incredible.  Take time to look at all the details, you will be amazed at all the tiny things you will see.  Also ask the docent to turn the light off to view the winter scene with it's lights on.  You will be amazed at how different it looks with only the lights on inside this display.

data.title: Tiny Collections!
data.text: Both adults and children will enjoy a visit to this small but unique museum! Close to shops and eating options in downtown Carmel.

data.title: Never knew miniature houses could be fun
data.text: Visited the museum with my teen sons. Just wanted something different to do so they humored me and went along for the tour. I cannot even describe how many little houses that we saw. We spent at least two hours looking in awe at all they had to display.  It is a wonderful way to spend some time enjoying the work of someone else. Several displays were new but many had been worked on for years. The displays do change. It was worth the small admission fee we paid.

data.title: Hidden (in plain sight!) Treasure
data.text:
I had not heard of this museum until this year and I am really glad I did! It is a fun, inexpensive thing to do when you are looking for something unique. There are several antique miniature houses and several new ones. Each one is well described and full of a lot of detail. We thoroughly enjoyed wandering through the rooms and taking it all in.
Also, if you are making your own miniature room or house, they do have some miniatures for sale.

data.title: Lots of miniatures
data.text: If you like miniatures this is a place to go. If not, not much else. There are a variety of displays, maybe three for four rooms. Frankly it is not my cup of tea. My potential future daughter in law wanted to go and she enjoyed it. If you know someone who likes miniatures then go, otherwise there are a lot of bars nearby.

data.title: a pleasant surprise
data.text: A wide variety of miniature houses and furnishings that span a wide range of types and eras.  Everything is well presented, and you can get a very close look at the details.  Staff was helpful and friendly.  Well worth stopping by if you like miniature houses or models.  They also have some items for sale, although that is not the primary focus of the museum.

data.title: Loved it!
data.text: Drove by and was so glad I stopped. This place is a hidden jewel in miniatures.  You will be amazed by all the details and depth of the collection. I loved the history of the collections and the absolute perfection which went into each collection. Even if you are not a collector you will be impressed by the museum. I have been to many many museums, and this ranks as a must visit one!  Highly recommend!  I spent about two hours walking around this fairly small house!  My favorite (aside from all of it) was the fantasy princess and prince. Turn the lights off if you can-really worth it!

data.title: Charming Display of exquisite miniature houses, rooms, etc.
data.text: An enjoyable small  museum of the work of serious artisans and collectors.   You are free to wander the several rooms at your own pace. Some displays are whole houses, and some are just room displays, such as the Sherlock Holmes room with all the clues present from Doyle's books.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: I was astounded at the incredible assortment of such detailed miniature doll houses. An Egyptian palace, a log cabin, a mid-century modern?!? What a place to visit! We ended up staying 2-3 hours just to absorb all the detailing. My personal favorites were the metal doll houses that I personally played with in the 50's. All those feelings came rolling on back...Would happily return around holiday time when the houses are in decoration mode. A gem!

data.title: Fun!
data.text: Different and fun to do. If you are a detailed or meticulous person you might enjoy this museum even if you are not into miniatures. They display fine craftsmanship which is always a delight. Right downtown in the Carmel Arts and Design District. A fun day with many great restaurants and other fun boutiques and shopping nearby.

data.title: Miniature wonderland!
data.text: The absolutely charming museum is  filled with fully accessorized doll houses of many styles from over the years, as  well as other toys of bygone days.  Parents and grandparents will enjoy happy memories from their youths.  Children will love finding all of the items on a provided scavenger hunt list as they marvel over the intricate details of the houses and their furnishings.  A visit is fun for all ages.
